Hypertension

Hypertension should be treated elective surgery if it is greater than 180/110 or if there is end-organ damage (LVH, renal failure, retinopathy).

Grade 1: SBP > 140 or DBP > 90

Grade 2: SBP > 160 or DBP > 100

Grade 3: SBP > 180 or DBP > 110.

Hypertension associated with acute organ famage (AKI, pulmonary oedema, aortic dissection, ACS) should be treated with intravenous therapy. In acute stroke, BP should be controlled (15% reduction per 24h) if:

>220/120

>185/110 if thrombolysis indicated (NB Plts<100)

>180/105 after thrombolysis

See also intraoperative hypertension .

[European Society of Hypertension guidelines (2007)]
